snippet: ESCOBAR--Marisol. The American Academy of Arts and Letters notes with sorrow the death of this esteemed sculptor, who achieved early recognition as a "10th Street artist" in the '50s and the "queen of Pop Art" in the '60s and '70s. Her sculptures reflect gentle satire, understated humor and childlike directness. 1/3
lead_paragraph: ESCOBAR--Marisol. The American Academy of Arts and Letters notes with sorrow the death of this esteemed sculptor, who achieved early recognition as a "10th Street artist" in the '50s and the "queen of Pop Art" in the '60s and '70s. Her sculptures reflect gentle satire, understated humor and childlike directness. 1/3
